title: UWP XAML should be backwards compatible with older Windows 10 Versions
body: Currently it is really painful to add new Controls from newer Windows SDK versions to apps and still support older versions.

comments.body: Android tries to create support libraries with controls and styling that will work with apps released on older versions of the OS - As Windows 10 develops, and now Windows 10 mobile is being deprecated, it may be time to backport new controls/brushes to previous versions to help users target more versions as a minimum, instead of just adding conditional XAML going forward.
Awesome! How does that IntelliSense for Code-Behind work? would you still do an API check in code behind before you modified the new Control? Or is the code ignored on older versions?
